step1.sentence: By demanding a raise right before the company's annual review, he really shot himself in the foot and ended up with nothing.

step2.story: Sarah had been preparing for her job interview for weeks, but she shot herself in the foot by badmouthing her previous employer when asked why she left. The interviewer's expression changed immediately, and Sarah knew the opportunity was slipping away.

step3.story: Marcus had worked hard all semester and was just one exam away from his dream scholarship. The night before the test, his friends invited him to a party, and against his better judgment, he decided to go. He stayed out until 3 a.m., telling himself he'd still wake up early to review his notes. When the alarm went off, he silenced it and slept through the exam entirely. His advisor shook her head when Marcus explained what happened. 'You really shot yourself in the foot this time,' she said quietly, and Marcus had no words to argue.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 말 그대로는 자기 발에 총을 쏜다는 뜻이다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 실제로는 자신의 실수나 잘못된 행동으로 인해 스스로에게 피해를 입히거나 좋은 기회를 망칠 때 사용한다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 군대에서 전투를 피하기 위해 일부러 자신의 발에 총을 쏘던 행위에서 유래했으며, 이후 의도치 않게 자신을 망치는 행동을 묘사하는 표현으로 확장됐다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 어리석거나 충동적인 행동으로 스스로를 곤란하게 만들었을 때 쓰이며, 약간의 아이러니와 안타까움이 담긴 어조로 사용되는 경우가 많다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: He shot himself in the foot by submitting the report late after months of careful work.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 그는 몇 달간 공들인 보고서를 늦게 제출하는 바람에 스스로 발등을 찍었다.
